DataElement.preferredName: Biologically-Derived Material Product Material Name Code Change Text ISO21090.ST.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A substance made from living organisms or things they produce. EXAMPLE(S): virus, therapeutic serum, toxin, antitoxin, vaccine, blood, blood component or derivative, allergenic product, analogous product A character string that is a revision of the original text of the product to enable the coding of the text. EXAMPLE(S): If the original text is "aspriin", the nameCodeModifiedText could be set to "aspirin", so that the text can be successfully coded.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Biologically-Derived Material Product Material Name Code Change Text
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Natural substances derived from living organisms such as cells, tissues, proteins, and DNA.:The end result of a manufacturing process; anything that is produced.:The tangible substance that goes into the makeup of a physical object._The words or language units by which a thing is known.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.:The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.:The words of something written.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Natural substances derived from living organisms such as cells, tissues, proteins, and DNA.:The end result of a manufacturing process; anything that is produced.:The tangible substance that goes into the makeup of a physical object.

Concepts.definition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.
